name: [SR] Law Rules and Company Legislation
description:
Additional rules for legislation. Laws not following these will be considered as incorrectly applied code, as written intent validates laws. The following rules count as written intent for all legislation.

1. If a piece of legislation adjusts the reputation of a citizen, it may only add up to 10 reputation, or remove up to 10 reputation. Reputation adjustments greater than 10 in total are invalid.
 All taxes on White Tiger have to fulfill certain requirements. Taxes not fulfilling these requirements are invalid and their collection is not lawful.All the requirements on laws also apply to taxes, this only adds additional requirements.These requirements are as follows:1. the tax may not simply forget a person being unable to pay, the amount must be remembered and charged at a later time.
2. the tax may not block actions when being unable to pay.
3. the tax has to provide reporting to both citizens and the government. This reporting has to include how much of this specific tax was paid by the citizen in the last day and in total, as well as how much was paid for this tax by all citizens together in the last day and in total. The reporting also has to inform citizens of how much money they still owe to this tax.4. charging taxes through this tax has to be compatible to the federal tax reporting, which collects information on how much tax income the government received in both the last 24h and in total. This can be easily achieved by using the "smart" tax actions.
5. the tax may not target wealth gains or wealth acquired through the UBI. This means wealth taxes must have a 0% bracket of at least (UBI per hour * world age in hours) and income taxes must also have a 0% bracket of at least the UBI payments over its duration of collection (e.g. an income tax acting every 3 hours must have a 0% bracket of 3 * UBI per hour)6. the tax has to respect tax rebates for its respective treasury. For example, a property tax by the State of Virgata has to consider every tax rebate acting on the Treasury of Virgata.

properties.Title: [SR] Company Income Reduction
properties.UserDescription: Every group of collaborating players (=company) have reduced income if they have more skills than its member with the most skills (like our old skills rule forbid).

properties.Title: [SR] Setting Company Income Reduction Rates
properties.UserDescription: Once per hour, every company's reduction rate is evaluated. The reduction increases by 15% for each extra skill that is added to a company, so at 1 extra skill it is 15%, at 2 extra skills it is 15% + (0.85 * 15%) = 28%, at 3 extra skills it is ???% and so on. This is saved multiplied by 100 in the legal person so every government tax can access it. the *100 is so the accuracy is kept and the number is not roundedIf a company has 2 or less unique skills, this rule does not apply

properties.Title: Private Company Firing Protection
properties.UserDescription: Employees of a Private Company (Type 1) may only be fired if they haven't logged in for 72 hours. They are not permitted to leave the company on their own. Therefore, the code always prevents leaving if the employee played any time during the last 3 days. We do not have to check for "fired", because if a citizen logs in to leave on their own, they only have until the next civics tick, or they gain hours played and are unable to leave themselves, so a maximum of 5 minutes. So it is basically not possible to leave on your own.
